results.title: Forgotten Cinema
results.creator_credit: Anthony Buckley and Anthony Buckley Productions
results.brief_description: A history of theatrical film production in Australia including brief extracts from features illustrating development from the 19th Century to the postwar period. The problems of distribution of Australian films are explored, and well known film industry figures Ken G. Hall and Mrs. Elsa Chauvel discuss difficulties encountered.
results.description: A history of theatrical film production in Australia including brief extracts from features illustrating development from the 19th Century to the postwar period. results.title: Farm work forging. No. 1. Forging with a hand forge
results.creator_credit: F.E. Brooker, H Woodard and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description: How to clean the Tuyere and build an open fire in a forge; how to maintain the fire and coke the coal; how to lay out and mark the stock; how to heat mild steel for forging; how to forge an eye.

results.title: Forge and ornamental iron
results.creator_credit: Alan Lloyd, Joe Hayward and Moreland-Latchford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hand Operations-Metal Work”.
A description of the gas forge and its operation. Shows various tongs, parts of the anvil, and safety rules in forge operation.

results.title: The Forest: pulp logger
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The history of the timber industry in Eastern Canada. England deprived of its timber supplies after Napoleon’s conquest of Europe turned to Canada. The move west in America increased the demand for timber, and the advent of newspapers created a need for wood pulp. Today the highly mechanised timber industry makes Canada the largest exporter in the world.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Forest without spears
results.creator_credit: Lionel Hudson, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Bulolo Valley in New Guinea was once a mere hunting ground; now it is the home of the Commonwealth New Guinea Timbers, a company cutting 10 million square feet of Klinki pine a year. Compares pre-war mining operations by dredge and the forestry industry of today; the milling operations, growing seedling trees, felling mature ones; transport; transformation into the finished product; importance to the people of the area of the industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lionel Hudson, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: The Forest watchers
results.creator_credit: Peter Raymont, Colin Low, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Forest watchers tells us some remarkable things about one of our great natural resources. For example, nearly one half of Canada is forest, by the end of the century the supply might fall short of the demand. This film looks at the Canadian forests and the elements threatening them. These include the spruce budworm, air pollution and indiscriminate logging operations. Man is in the process of developing a new vision of the forest through the advent of remote sensing techniques. Written by Peter Raymont; photographed by Andreas Poulsson, Raymond Dumas; music by Larry Crosley.

results.title: Forest under siege
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Two million six hundred square kilometres of forest are the feeding-grounds of armies of insects. This film shows the devastation, its causes, and the many ways in which the Canadian Forestry Service, with the help of the provincial governments, is fighting this vast attack.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Colin Low, Desmond Dew and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Forest to foundry
results.creator_credit: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: Wundowie, Western Australia is known for its sawmills and its pig-iron foundry. It is in the midst of the jarrah country and two sawmills produce high grade timber. Iron ore is brought to Wundowie from the quarries and there reduced to pig-iron in blast furnaces with the charcoal produced from the timber waste.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Norman A. Uren and Western Australian Government Film Unit

results.title: The Forest regions of Canada
results.creator_credit: Herb Taylor, Frank Spiller and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A country-wide survey of the changing technology of lumbering and the system of long-range reforestation. Shown is a machine that strips a tree of branches, then neatly bites through the base and lowers it onto a timber carrier; and a machine that reduces logs to wood chips right in the forest, for easier transport to the mill. Animated maps show the locations of the various forest regions of Canada. (Award: Santarem).
